issue.body: ### Describe the issue 【环境】 小米净化器中有湿度传感器，已经正常介入到ha中，也能查询到正常的数值 但是用消毒音响绑定上这个设备后，查询到的值是4100% ### Link to action run Null ### Link to action configuration Null ### Checklist - [X] I have filled out the issue template to the best of my ability. - [X] I have read - [X] This issue is related to the HACS action. - [X] This issue only contains 1 issue (if you have multiple issues, open one issue for each issue).

issue.title: Github added dated versions header to API requests.
issue.body:
### System Health details


[health.txt](https://github.com/hacs/integration/files/10145886/health.txt)


### Checklist

- [X] I'm running the newest version of HACS <https://github.com/hacs/integration/releases/latest>
- [X] I have enabled debug logging for my installation.
- [X] I have filled out the issue template to the best of my ability.
- [X] I have read <https://hacs.xyz/docs/issues>
- [X] This issue is related to the backend (integration part) of HACS.
- [X] This issue only contains 1 issue (if you have multiple issues, open one issue for each issue).
- [X] This issue is not a duplicate issue of currently [open](https://github.com/hacs/integration/issues) or issues [pending release](https://github.com/hacs/integration/issues?q=is%3Aissue+is%3Aclosed+sort%3Aupdated-desc+milestone%3Anext).

### Describe the issue

Whilst investigating another issue (TBA), I noticed a large number of debug messages coming from aiogithubapi during HACS startup. 

The errors are all similar to;
2022-12-03 06:02:50.039 DEBUG (MainThread) [aiogithubapi] 'GitHubResponseHeadersModel' is missing key 'x_github_api_version_selected' for <class 'str'> 

It appears to be mostly cosmetic side effects of github API calling convention changes (https://docs.github.com/en/rest/overview/api-versions?apiVersion=2022-11-28).  Presumably, these will be fixed with a aiogithubapi bump at some point but there's some possible side-effects already showing.

### Reproduction steps

1. Restart HA
2. Turn on debug level logging for HACS/aiogithubapi 
3. Consult logs :-)

### Debug logs

- [X] This issue is related to the frontend of HACS.

- [X] This issue is not a duplicate issue of currently [open](https://github.com/hacs/integration/issues) or issues [pending release](https://github.com/hacs/integration/issues?q=is%3Aissue+is%3Aclosed+sort%3Aupdated-desc+milestone%3Anext).

### Describe the issue

UI of HACS is the experimental one although I turned off the `experimental` flag in configuration.

No option to reopen #2947 so I'm opening it as a new one
**All the actions below are incluing cleaning the cache, restart the HA after every action**

Attempts to change consisted with:
- Turn of the experimental flag
- Removing it from the core entities directly
- Removing and reinstall HACS (after cleaning all the hacs data in .storage)
- Incognito mode, still getting experimental UI.




### Reproduction steps

1. Open the HACS – UI is a list of experimental UI
2. Open configuration of HACS
3. Untick the experimental checkbox
4. Restart HA
5. Clean browser cache
6. Open HACS – same result
7. Restart HA once again
8. Open HACS – same result
9. Open HA in incognito mode
10. Open HACS – same result
11. Uninstall the integration
12. Restart HA 
13. Delete all HACS files from /config/.storage
14. Install HACS
15. Restart HA 
16. Open HACS – same result
17. Uninstall HACS
18. Remove from custom components
19. Verifying nothing left in custom components directory from HACS
20. Delete all HACS files from /config/.storage
21. Restart HA 
22. Download again HACS
23. Restart HA 
24. Install HACS
25. Restart HA 
26. Open HACS – same result


### Screenshots

![image](https://user-images.githubusercontent.com/3207137/205292887-2ddfb09d-f2b6-43ba-8e0b-ae14013daf74.png)

### Javascript logs from your browser console

```text
no logs in console (all clean)
```

_No response_

issue.body:

- [X] I have filled out the issue template to the best of my ability.

- [X] This issue only contains 1 issue (if you have multiple issues, open one issue for each issue).
- [X] This issue is not a duplicate issue of currently [open](https://github.com/hacs/integration/issues) or issues [pending release](https://github.com/hacs/integration/issues?q=is%3Aissue+is%3Aclosed+sort%3Aupdated-desc+milestone%3Anext).

### Describe the issue

hello

### Describe the issue

When installing HACS on Home Assistant Core with Python 3.11 producing an error in file hacs/repositories/integration.py on line 169
To temporarily fix the error, replace:
`else f"{self.content.path.remote}/{RepositoryFile.MAINIFEST_JSON}"`
on:
`else f"{self.content.path.remote}/manifest.json"`

### Reproduction steps

1. Install Python 3.11
2. Install HA and HACS
3. Open Link: {HA host}/hacs/repository/172733314 (HACS Page)

Expect:
Open HACS readme page

Actually:
Unknow Error

issue.body:
### Web browser

### System Health details

### Describe the issue

On my HACS installation (updated to latest release) it seems like there's some incorrect key or placeholder for the Spanish translation... I checked on lokalise and it seems it's 100% so maybe it's a wrong text key or something?
It reads 'sections.pending_repository_upgrade' under the updateable custom components... 

https://i.imgur.com/VTL9A0x.png

### Reproduction steps

1. Load HACS with Spanish as the frontend language
2. Have repositories pending upgrade

### Describe the issue

Working in HA, I noticed HACS disappeared from menu side bar.  Checked and found it failed to start with following errors below.  I searched and found a suggestion to uninstall, delete folder, restart HA 2x and de-auth.  I then tried reinstalling and get the same errors in log (below) after "fresh" install.  I do find an error referring to HACS but am not sure what it is referring to - see debug log line 1.

### Reproduction steps

1. Not really sure what I did to cause this.  I did install or configure UnPnP to get stats from my Google WIFI but I am unsure when the issue occurred, before - during - or after.
2.
3.
...


### Debug logs

```text
* CANNOT PASTE FULL LOG *  ISSUE SUBMISSION FAILS FOR BEING TOO LONG

HACS is disabled - HacsDisabledReason.RESTORE
4:56:24 AM – (ERROR) HACS (custom integration)
Could not read /config/.storage/hacs.repositories, restore the file from a backup - unexpected character: line 14690 column 20 (char 488454)
4:56:24 AM – (ERROR) HACS (custom integration)
Could not parse JSON content: /config/.storage/hacs.repositories
```


### Diagnostics dump

I have no option for diagnostics dump.

issue.title: Retain execution permission from files
issue.body:
### System Health details

N/A

### Checklist

- [X] I'm running the newest version of HACS <https://github.com/hacs/integration/releases/latest>
- [X] I have enabled debug logging for my installation.
- [X] I have filled out the issue template to the best of my ability.
- [X] I have read <https://hacs.xyz/docs/issues>
- [X] This issue is related to the backend (integration part) of HACS.
- [X] This issue only contains 1 issue (if you have multiple issues, open one issue for each issue).
- [X] This issue is not a duplicate issue of currently [open](https://github.com/hacs/integration/issues) or issues [pending release](https://github.com/hacs/integration/issues?q=is%3Aissue+is%3Aclosed+sort%3Aupdated-desc+milestone%3Anext).

### Describe the issue

I have a custom integration which comes with a script, which can be reused by users without having to create their own:

https://github.com/felipecrs/hass-expose-camera-stream-source/blob/master/custom_components/expose_camera_stream_source/get_stream.sh

The script above has execution permission set (`chmod +x`/`git add --chmod=+x`), but when HACS installs it, the execution permission is lost.

### Reproduction steps

Install my custom component, and try to run:

```console
/config/custom_components/expose_camera_stream_source/get_stream.sh
```

It will fail with permission denied.

If you instead clone the repository by ourself, you won't get permission denied.

### Debug logs

```text
N/A
```


### Diagnostics dump

N/A

issue.title: Entering into a repository and going back to explore repository page causes UI to jump to top position and not position of the last repository entered
issue.body:

- [X] This issue is not a duplicate issue of currently [open](https://github.com/hacs/integration/issues) or issues [pending release](https://github.com/hacs/integration/issues?q=is%3Aissue+is%3Aclosed+sort%3Aupdated-desc+milestone%3Anext).

### Describe the issue

Selecting and entering a repository from the repository explorer and then going back to the repository explorer causes the page position to jump back to top and not at the last position before entering the repository.  This makes it hard to find the previous position again.  

Example in iOS shown but the same is experienced on other platforms

### Reproduction steps

1.Open HACS in Home Assistant
2.Select "+" or "Explore and Download Repositories".
3.Scroll down to any repository
4. Enter repository
5. Go back by pressuing "<-"
6. Position will return to top and not to last position prior to entering the repository
...


### Screenshots


https://user-images.githubusercontent.com/63410825/200134208-d7738726-c186-45e2-8727-d5f2e22fbb03.mov

```

issue.title: Github added dated versions header to API requests.
issue.body:
### System Health details


[health.txt](https://github.com/hacs/integration/files/10145886/health.txt)


### Checklist

- [X] I'm running the newest version of HACS <https://github.com/hacs/integration/releases/latest>
- [X] I have enabled debug logging for my installation.
- [X] I have filled out the issue template to the best of my ability.
- [X] I have read <https://hacs.xyz/docs/issues>
- [X] This issue is related to the backend (integration part) of HACS.
- [X] This issue only contains 1 issue (if you have multiple issues, open one issue for each issue).
- [X] This issue is not a duplicate issue of currently [open](https://github.com/hacs/integration/issues) or issues [pending release](https://github.com/hacs/integration/issues?q=is%3Aissue+is%3Aclosed+sort%3Aupdated-desc+milestone%3Anext).

### Describe the issue

Whilst investigating another issue (TBA), I noticed a large number of debug messages coming from aiogithubapi during HACS startup. 

The errors are all similar to;
2022-12-03 06:02:50.039 DEBUG (MainThread) [aiogithubapi] 'GitHubResponseHeadersModel' is missing key 'x_github_api_version_selected' for <class 'str'> 

It appears to be mostly cosmetic side effects of github API calling convention changes (https://docs.github.com/en/rest/overview/api-versions?apiVersion=2022-11-28).  Presumably, these will be fixed with a aiogithubapi bump at some point but there's some possible side-effects already showing.

### Reproduction steps

1. Restart HA
2. Turn on debug level logging for HACS/aiogithubapi 
3. Consult logs :-)

### Checklist

- [X] I'm running the newest version of HACS <https://github.com/hacs/integration/releases/latest>
- [X] I have filled out the issue template to the best of my ability.
- [X] I have read <https://hacs.xyz/docs/issues>
- [X] This issue is related to the frontend of HACS.
- [X] This issue only contains 1 issue (if you have multiple issues, open one issue for each issue).
- [X] This issue is not a duplicate issue of currently [open](https://github.com/hacs/integration/issues) or issues [pending release](https://github.com/hacs/integration/issues?q=is%3Aissue+is%3Aclosed+sort%3Aupdated-desc+milestone%3Anext).

### Describe the issue

UI of HACS is the experimental one although I turned off the `experimental` flag in configuration.

No option to reopen #2947 so I'm opening it as a new one
**All the actions below are incluing cleaning the cache, restart the HA after every action**

Attempts to change consisted with:
- Turn of the experimental flag
- Removing it from the core entities directly
- Removing and reinstall HACS (after cleaning all the hacs data in .storage)
- Incognito mode, still getting experimental UI.




### Reproduction steps

1. Open the HACS – UI is a list of experimental UI
2. Open configuration of HACS
3. Untick the experimental checkbox
4. Restart HA
5. Clean browser cache
6. Open HACS – same result
7. Restart HA once again
8. Open HACS – same result
9. Open HA in incognito mode
10. Open HACS – same result
11. Uninstall the integration
12. Restart HA 
13. Delete all HACS files from /config/.storage
14. Install HACS
15. Restart HA 
16. Open HACS – same result
17. Uninstall HACS
18. Remove from custom components
19. Verifying nothing left in custom components directory from HACS
20. Delete all HACS files from /config/.storage
21. Restart HA 
22. Download again HACS
23. Restart HA 
24. Install HACS
25. Restart HA 
26. Open HACS – same result


### Screenshots

![image](https://user-images.githubusercontent.com/3207137/205292887-2ddfb09d-f2b6-43ba-8e0b-ae14013daf74.png)

### Javascript logs from your browser console

```text
no logs in console (all clean)
```


### Diagnostics dump

_No response_

Make sure you have read the [issue guidelines](https://hacs.xyz/docs/issues) and that you filled out the **entire** template.


If you have an issue identical to this, do **not** add comments like "same here", "i have this too", instead add a :+1: reaction to the issue description. Thanks! :+1:

### Describe the issue

I simply cannot add new custom repositories, see attached GIF. When I click "Add", the button spins and then nothing happens...

### Reproduction steps

1. Open HACS
2. Navigate to *Integrations*
3. Click on three dots on the upper right corner
4. Click on "Custom repositories"
5. Paste the link: `https://github.com/vlebourl/shopping_list`
6. Select the category "Integration"
7. Click on Add
...

### Describe the issue

When installing HACS on Home Assistant Core with Python 3.11 producing an error in file hacs/repositories/integration.py on line 169
To temporarily fix the error, replace:
`else f"{self.content.path.remote}/{RepositoryFile.MAINIFEST_JSON}"`
on:
`else f"{self.content.path.remote}/manifest.json"`

### Reproduction steps

1. Install Python 3.11
2. Install HA and HACS
3. Open Link: {HA host}/hacs/repository/172733314 (HACS Page)

Expect:
Open HACS readme page

Actually:
Unknow Error

issue.title: 'sections.pending_repository_upgrade' shown
issue.body:
### Web browser

Chrome

### Web browser version

107.0.5304.107

### System Health details

n/a

### Checklist

- [X] I'm running the newest version of HACS <https://github.com/hacs/integration/releases/latest>
- [X] I have filled out the issue template to the best of my ability.
- [X] I have read <https://hacs.xyz/docs/issues>
- [X] This issue is related to the frontend of HACS.
- [X] This issue only contains 1 issue (if you have multiple issues, open one issue for each issue).
- [X] This issue is not a duplicate issue of currently [open](https://github.com/hacs/integration/issues) or issues [pending release](https://github.com/hacs/integration/issues?q=is%3Aissue+is%3Aclosed+sort%3Aupdated-desc+milestone%3Anext).

### Describe the issue

On my HACS installation (updated to latest release) it seems like there's some incorrect key or placeholder for the Spanish translation... I checked on lokalise and it seems it's 100% so maybe it's a wrong text key or something?
It reads 'sections.pending_repository_upgrade' under the updateable custom components... 

https://i.imgur.com/VTL9A0x.png

### Reproduction steps

1. Load HACS with Spanish as the frontend language
2. Have repositories pending upgrade

### Screenshots

![image](https://user-images.githubusercontent.com/12327380/202938304-50d8dde3-598c-404f-a064-b3bd5de1bd0b.png)


### Javascript logs from your browser console

```text
n/a
```


### Diagnostics dump

_No response_

issue.body:

### Checklist

- [X] I'm running the newest version of HACS <https://github.com/hacs/integration/releases/latest>
- [X] I have enabled debug logging for my installation.
- [X] I have filled out the issue template to the best of my ability.
- [X] I have read <https://hacs.xyz/docs/issues>
- [X] This issue is related to the backend (integration part) of HACS.
- [X] This issue only contains 1 issue (if you have multiple issues, open one issue for each issue).
- [X] This issue is not a duplicate issue of currently [open](https://github.com/hacs/integration/issues) or issues [pending release](https://github.com/hacs/integration/issues?q=is%3Aissue+is%3Aclosed+sort%3Aupdated-desc+milestone%3Anext).

### Describe the issue

Working in HA, I noticed HACS disappeared from menu side bar.  Checked and found it failed to start with following errors below.  I searched and found a suggestion to uninstall, delete folder, restart HA 2x and de-auth.  I then tried reinstalling and get the same errors in log (below) after "fresh" install.  I do find an error referring to HACS but am not sure what it is referring to - see debug log line 1.

HACS is disabled - HacsDisabledReason.RESTORE
4:33:26 AM – (ERROR) HACS (custom integration) - message first occurred at November 19, 2022 at 5:01:55 PM and shows up 94 times
Could not read /config/.storage/hacs.repositories, restore the file from a backup - unexpected character: line 14690 column 20 (char 488454)
4:33:26 AM – (ERROR) HACS (custom integration) - message first occurred at November 19, 2022 at 5:01:55 PM and shows up 94 times
Could not parse JSON content: /config/.storage/hacs.repositories
4:33:26 AM – (ERROR) util/json.py - message first occurred at November 19, 2022 at 5:01:55 PM and shows up 94 times



### Reproduction steps

1. Not really sure what I did to cause this.  I did install or configure UnPnP to get stats from my Google WIFI but I am unsure when the issue occurred, before - during - or after.
2.
3.
...


### Debug logs

```text
* CANNOT PASTE FULL LOG *  ISSUE SUBMISSION FAILS FOR BEING TOO LONG

HACS is disabled - HacsDisabledReason.RESTORE
4:56:24 AM – (ERROR) HACS (custom integration)
Could not read /config/.storage/hacs.repositories, restore the file from a backup - unexpected character: line 14690 column 20 (char 488454)
4:56:24 AM – (ERROR) HACS (custom integration)
Could not parse JSON content: /config/.storage/hacs.repositories
```


### Diagnostics dump

I have no option for diagnostics dump.

![image](https://user-images.githubusercontent.com/71104315/202898532-e358d301-47db-4ca9-bea4-faadcde8b5f4.png)

issue.title: Retain execution permission from files
issue.body:
### System Health details

N/A

### Checklist

- [X] I'm running the newest version of HACS <https://github.com/hacs/integration/releases/latest>
- [X] I have enabled debug logging for my installation.
- [X] I have filled out the issue template to the best of my ability.
- [X] I have read <https://hacs.xyz/docs/issues>
- [X] This issue is related to the backend (integration part) of HACS.
- [X] This issue only contains 1 issue (if you have multiple issues, open one issue for each issue).
- [X] This issue is not a duplicate issue of currently [open](https://github.com/hacs/integration/issues) or issues [pending release](https://github.com/hacs/integration/issues?q=is%3Aissue+is%3Aclosed+sort%3Aupdated-desc+milestone%3Anext).

### Describe the issue

I have a custom integration which comes with a script, which can be reused by users without having to create their own:

https://github.com/felipecrs/hass-expose-camera-stream-source/blob/master/custom_components/expose_camera_stream_source/get_stream.sh

The script above has execution permission set (`chmod +x`/`git add --chmod=+x`), but when HACS installs it, the execution permission is lost.

### Reproduction steps

Install my custom component, and try to run:

```console
/config/custom_components/expose_camera_stream_source/get_stream.sh
```

It will fail with permission denied.

If you instead clone the repository by ourself, you won't get permission denied.

### Debug logs

```text
N/A
```


### Diagnostics dump

N/A

issue.body:
### Web browser

### Web browser version

### Checklist

- [X] I'm running the newest version of HACS <https://github.com/hacs/integration/releases/latest>
- [X] I have filled out the issue template to the best of my ability.
- [X] I have read <https://hacs.xyz/docs/issues>
- [X] This issue is related to the frontend of HACS.
- [X] This issue only contains 1 issue (if you have multiple issues, open one issue for each issue).
- [X] This issue is not a duplicate issue of currently [open](https://github.com/hacs/integration/issues) or issues [pending release](https://github.com/hacs/integration/issues?q=is%3Aissue+is%3Aclosed+sort%3Aupdated-desc+milestone%3Anext).

### Describe the issue

Selecting and entering a repository from the repository explorer and then going back to the repository explorer causes the page position to jump back to top and not at the last position before entering the repository.  This makes it hard to find the previous position again.  

Example in iOS shown but the same is experienced on other platforms

### Reproduction steps

1.Open HACS in Home Assistant
2.Select "+" or "Explore and Download Repositories".
3.Scroll down to any repository
4. Enter repository
5. Go back by pressuing "<-"
6. Position will return to top and not to last position prior to entering the repository
...


### Screenshots


https://user-images.githubusercontent.com/63410825/200134208-d7738726-c186-45e2-8727-d5f2e22fbb03.mov



### Javascript logs from your browser console

```text
Compatibility
'content-type' header charset value should be 'utf-8'.
'content-type' header media type value should be 'image/png', not 'text/html'.
Performance
A 'cache-control' header is missing or empty.
Resource should use cache busting but URL does not match configured patterns.
Static resources should use a 'cache-control' header with 'max-age=31536000' or more.
Static resources should use a 'cache-control' header with the 'immutable' directive.
Security
Response should include 'x-content-type-options' header.
The 'Expires' header should not be used, 'Cache-Control' should be preferred.
The 'server' header should only contain the server name.
Other
Audit usage of navigator.userAgent, navigator.appVersion, and navigator.platform
```


### Diagnostics dump

_No response_

issue.title: Github added dated versions header to API requests.
issue.body:
### System Health details


[health.txt](https://github.com/hacs/integration/files/10145886/health.txt)


### Checklist

- [X] I'm running the newest version of HACS <https://github.com/hacs/integration/releases/latest>
- [X] I have enabled debug logging for my installation.
- [X] I have filled out the issue template to the best of my ability.
- [X] I have read <https://hacs.xyz/docs/issues>
- [X] This issue is related to the backend (integration part) of HACS.
- [X] This issue only contains 1 issue (if you have multiple issues, open one issue for each issue).
- [X] This issue is not a duplicate issue of currently [open](https://github.com/hacs/integration/issues) or issues [pending release](https://github.com/hacs/integration/issues?q=is%3Aissue+is%3Aclosed+sort%3Aupdated-desc+milestone%3Anext).

### Describe the issue

Whilst investigating another issue (TBA), I noticed a large number of debug messages coming from aiogithubapi during HACS startup. 

The errors are all similar to;
2022-12-03 06:02:50.039 DEBUG (MainThread) [aiogithubapi] 'GitHubResponseHeadersModel' is missing key 'x_github_api_version_selected' for <class 'str'> 

It appears to be mostly cosmetic side effects of github API calling convention changes (https://docs.github.com/en/rest/overview/api-versions?apiVersion=2022-11-28).  Presumably, these will be fixed with a aiogithubapi bump at some point but there's some possible side-effects already showing.

### Reproduction steps

1. Restart HA
2. Turn on debug level logging for HACS/aiogithubapi 
3. Consult logs :-)

### Debug logs

issue.title: Cannot get non-experimental UI

### Checklist

- [X] I'm running the newest version of HACS <https://github.com/hacs/integration/releases/latest>
- [X] I have filled out the issue template to the best of my ability.
- [X] I have read <https://hacs.xyz/docs/issues>
- [X] This issue is related to the frontend of HACS.
- [X] This issue only contains 1 issue (if you have multiple issues, open one issue for each issue).
- [X] This issue is not a duplicate issue of currently [open](https://github.com/hacs/integration/issues) or issues [pending release](https://github.com/hacs/integration/issues?q=is%3Aissue+is%3Aclosed+sort%3Aupdated-desc+milestone%3Anext).

### Describe the issue

UI of HACS is the experimental one although I turned off the `experimental` flag in configuration.

No option to reopen #2947 so I'm opening it as a new one
**All the actions below are incluing cleaning the cache, restart the HA after every action**

Attempts to change consisted with:
- Turn of the experimental flag
- Removing it from the core entities directly
- Removing and reinstall HACS (after cleaning all the hacs data in .storage)
- Incognito mode, still getting experimental UI.




### Reproduction steps

1. Open the HACS – UI is a list of experimental UI
2. Open configuration of HACS
3. Untick the experimental checkbox
4. Restart HA
5. Clean browser cache
6. Open HACS – same result
7. Restart HA once again
8. Open HACS – same result
9. Open HA in incognito mode
10. Open HACS – same result
11. Uninstall the integration
12. Restart HA 
13. Delete all HACS files from /config/.storage
14. Install HACS
15. Restart HA 
16. Open HACS – same result
17. Uninstall HACS
18. Remove from custom components
19. Verifying nothing left in custom components directory from HACS
20. Delete all HACS files from /config/.storage
21. Restart HA 
22. Download again HACS
23. Restart HA

### Checklist

- [X] This issue only contains 1 issue (if you have multiple issues, open one issue for each issue).
- [X] This issue is not a duplicate issue of currently [open](https://github.com/hacs/integration/issues) or issues [pending release](https://github.com/hacs/integration/issues?q=is%3Aissue+is%3Aclosed+sort%3Aupdated-desc+milestone%3Anext).

### Describe the issue

When installing HACS on Home Assistant Core with Python 3.11 producing an error in file hacs/repositories/integration.py on line 169
To temporarily fix the error, replace:
`else f"{self.content.path.remote}/{RepositoryFile.MAINIFEST_JSON}"`
on:
`else f"{self.content.path.remote}/manifest.json"`

### Reproduction steps

1. Install Python 3.11
2. Install HA and HACS
3. Open Link: {HA host}/hacs/repository/172733314 (HACS Page)

Expect:
Open HACS readme page

Actually:
Unknow Error


### Debug logs

```text

  File "/data/data/com.termux/files/home/.homeassistant/custom_components/hacs/utils/decorator.py", line 28, in wrapper

issue.title: 'sections.pending_repository_upgrade' shown
issue.body:
### Web browser

Chrome

### Web browser version

107.0.5304.107

### System Health details

n/a

### Checklist

- [X] I'm running the newest version of HACS <https://github.com/hacs/integration/releases/latest>
- [X] I have filled out the issue template to the best of my ability.
- [X] I have read <https://hacs.xyz/docs/issues>
- [X] This issue is related to the frontend of HACS.
- [X] This issue only contains 1 issue (if you have multiple issues, open one issue for each issue).
- [X] This issue is not a duplicate issue of currently [open](https://github.com/hacs/integration/issues) or issues [pending release](https://github.com/hacs/integration/issues?q=is%3Aissue+is%3Aclosed+sort%3Aupdated-desc+milestone%3Anext).

### Describe the issue

On my HACS installation (updated to latest release) it seems like there's some incorrect key or placeholder for the Spanish translation... I checked on lokalise and it seems it's 100% so maybe it's a wrong text key or something?
It reads 'sections.pending_repository_upgrade' under the updateable custom components... 

https://i.imgur.com/VTL9A0x.png

### Reproduction steps

1. Load HACS with Spanish as the frontend language
2. Have repositories pending upgrade

### Screenshots

![image](https://user-images.githubusercontent.com/12327380/202938304-50d8dde3-598c-404f-a064-b3bd5de1bd0b.png)


### Javascript logs from your browser console

```text
n/a
```


### Diagnostics dump

_No response_

### Describe the issue

Working in HA, I noticed HACS disappeared from menu side bar.  Checked and found it failed to start with following errors below.  I searched and found a suggestion to uninstall, delete folder, restart HA 2x and de-auth.  I then tried reinstalling and get the same errors in log (below) after "fresh" install.  I do find an error referring to HACS but am not sure what it is referring to - see debug log line 1.

HACS is disabled - HacsDisabledReason.RESTORE
4:33:26 AM – (ERROR) HACS (custom integration) - message first occurred at November 19, 2022 at 5:01:55 PM and shows up 94 times
Could not read /config/.storage/hacs.repositories, restore the file from a backup - unexpected character: line 14690 column 20 (char 488454)
4:33:26 AM – (ERROR) HACS (custom integration) - message first occurred at November 19, 2022 at 5:01:55 PM and shows up 94 times
Could not parse JSON content: /config/.storage/hacs.repositories
4:33:26 AM – (ERROR) util/json.py - message first occurred at November 19, 2022 at 5:01:55 PM and shows up 94 times



### Reproduction steps

1. Not really sure what I did to cause this.  I did install or configure UnPnP to get stats from my Google WIFI but I am unsure when the issue occurred, before - during - or after.
2.
3.
...


### Debug logs

```text
* CANNOT PASTE FULL LOG *  ISSUE SUBMISSION FAILS FOR BEING TOO LONG

HACS is disabled - HacsDisabledReason.RESTORE
4:56:24 AM – (ERROR) HACS (custom integration)
Could not read /config/.storage/hacs.repositories, restore the file from a backup - unexpected character: line 14690 column 20 (char 488454)
4:56:24 AM – (ERROR) HACS (custom integration)
Could not parse JSON content: /config/.storage/hacs.repositories
```


### Diagnostics dump

I have no option for diagnostics dump.

![image](https://user-images.githubusercontent.com/71104315/202898532-e358d301-47db-4ca9-bea4-faadcde8b5f4.png)

issue.title: Retain execution permission from files
issue.body:
### System Health details

N/A

### Checklist

- [X] I'm running the newest version of HACS <https://github.com/hacs/integration/releases/latest>
- [X] I have enabled debug logging for my installation.
- [X] I have filled out the issue template to the best of my ability.
- [X] I have read <https://hacs.xyz/docs/issues>
- [X] This issue is related to the backend (integration part) of HACS.
- [X] This issue only contains 1 issue (if you have multiple issues, open one issue for each issue).
- [X] This issue is not a duplicate issue of currently [open](https://github.com/hacs/integration/issues) or issues [pending release](https://github.com/hacs/integration/issues?q=is%3Aissue+is%3Aclosed+sort%3Aupdated-desc+milestone%3Anext).

### Describe the issue

I have a custom integration which comes with a script, which can be reused by users without having to create their own:

https://github.com/felipecrs/hass-expose-camera-stream-source/blob/master/custom_components/expose_camera_stream_source/get_stream.sh

The script above has execution permission set (`chmod +x`/`git add --chmod=+x`), but when HACS installs it, the execution permission is lost.

### Reproduction steps

Install my custom component, and try to run:

```console
/config/custom_components/expose_camera_stream_source/get_stream.sh
```

It will fail with permission denied.

If you instead clone the repository by ourself, you won't get permission denied.

### Debug logs

```text
N/A
```


### Diagnostics dump

N/A

issue.title: Entering into a repository and going back to explore repository page causes UI to jump to top position and not position of the last repository entered
issue.body:
### Web browser

Edge, Safari

### Web browser version

Edge 107.0.1418.26, Safari (iOS 16.1 (20B82)

### System Health details

</details>

### Checklist

- [X] I'm running the newest version of HACS <https://github.com/hacs/integration/releases/latest>
- [X] I have filled out the issue template to the best of my ability.
- [X] I have read <https://hacs.xyz/docs/issues>
- [X] This issue is related to the frontend of HACS.
- [X] This issue only contains 1 issue (if you have multiple issues, open one issue for each issue).
- [X] This issue is not a duplicate issue of currently [open](https://github.com/hacs/integration/issues) or issues [pending release](https://github.com/hacs/integration/issues?q=is%3Aissue+is%3Aclosed+sort%3Aupdated-desc+milestone%3Anext).

### Describe the issue

Selecting and entering a repository from the repository explorer and then going back to the repository explorer causes the page position to jump back to top and not at the last position before entering the repository.  This makes it hard to find the previous position again.  

Example in iOS shown but the same is experienced on other platforms

### Reproduction steps

1.Open HACS in Home Assistant
2.Select "+" or "Explore and Download Repositories".
3.Scroll down to any repository
4. Enter repository
5. Go back by pressuing "<-"
6. Position will return to top and not to last position prior to entering the repository
...


### Screenshots


https://user-images.githubusercontent.com/63410825/200134208-d7738726-c186-45e2-8727-d5f2e22fbb03.mov



### Javascript logs from your browser console

```text
Compatibility
'content-type' header charset value should be 'utf-8'.
'content-type' header media type value should be 'image/png', not 'text/html'.
Performance
A 'cache-control' header is missing or empty.
Resource should use cache busting but URL does not match configured patterns.
Static resources should use a 'cache-control' header with 'max-age=31536000' or more.
Static resources should use a 'cache-control' header with the 'immutable' directive.
Security
Response should include 'x-content-type-options' header.
The 'Expires' header should not be used, 'Cache-Control' should be preferred.
The 'server' header should only contain the server name.
Other
Audit usage of navigator.userAgent, navigator.appVersion, and navigator.platform
```


### Diagnostics dump

_No response_
